2020 Spring/Summer TV Premiere Calendar

  • by Jason Dietz, Metacritic Features Editor
  • Publish Date: February 26, 2020
  • Comments: ↓ 224 user comments

Past dates are listed below in reverse chronological order.

< Current/Future Premieres | 2019 Premieres >

Past TV premieres (2020)

MON / April 20
  90 Day Fiancé: Self-Quarantined Reality TLC, tbd
It was only a matter of time.
  Balthazar Foreign/Drama Acorn TV
▣ Cooked With Cannabis Reality competition
We're not sure why Netflix chose this date to launch this show, but we are certain that singer Kelis and chef Leather Storrs are the hosts for a competition that tasks professional chefs with creating a three-course meal featuring cannabis products.
  Dummy Trailer Comedy Quibi
  Iron Sharpens Iron Trailer Reality Quibi
▣ The Midnight Gospel Trailer Animation/Comedy
New eight-episode adult animated series comes from comedian Duncan Trussell and Adventure Time's Pendleton Ward. Very loosely adapted from Trussell's podcast, the series follows a podcaster who sets out to interview beings living in dying worlds.
▣ Why Don't You Just Die! Thriller/Comedy ($) Buy (Digital)
SUN / April 19
  Dragnificent! Reality TLC, 11p
  Hubble: Thirty Years of Discovery Documentary Science, 8p
  Killer Prom Drama Lifetime, 8p
▣ The Last Dance Trailer Documentary/Sports ESPN, 9p
Originally intended to air during the NBA playoffs in June, this 10-part limited series follows Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls during their 1997-98 season, the last championship year in their legendary 1990s dynasty. Two episodes air back-to-back tonight (and on the following four Sundays). Note that a family-friendly version (minus the profanity) will air simultaneously on ESPN2.
▣ The Longest War Documentary 10p
  Marvel's Spider-Man Animation Disney XD, 9p
  Snapped: Notorious Hollywood Ripper Reality Oxygen, 7p
SAT / April 18
  Crikey! It's the Irwins: Bindi's Wedding Reality Animal Planet, 8p
  Jungle Animal Rescue Reality Nat Geo Wild, 10p
  Nature of Love Drama Hallmark, 9p
▣ One World: Together at Home Variety Various, 8p
Simulcast on all three major broadcast networks as well as a variety of cable and streaming outlets including Facebook, Hulu, and Prime Video, this two-hour covid-19 fundraising special (to be specific: it's raising funds to combat the disease, not support it) will be hosted by Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Fallon, and Jimmy Kimmel and feature appearances by Paul McCartney, Elton John, Billie Eilish, John Legend, Chris Martin, Keith Urban, Lizzo, J Balvin, Stevie Wonder, Eddie Vedder, and more.
  OWN Spotlight: Black Women OWN the Conversation Special OWN, 10p
  Paranormal 911 Reality Travel, 9p
  Tempted by Danger Drama Lifetime, 8p
FRI / April 17
▣ Abe Family/Drama/Comedy ($) Rent/Buy (Digital)

Formerly known as Black Excellence, this single-camera sitcom is the first Netflix series from black-ish creator Kenya Barris. Barris himself stars alongside Rashida Jones.

▣ Other Music Documentary/Music ($) Rent (Digital)
Originally set for a theatrical release this month, the documentary about the beloved (but now shuttered) New York City record shop will now be available to rent this weekend via the website of an independent music store or theater near you.
▣ The Quarry Drama/Thriller ($) Rent (Digital)

▣ Sergio Trailer Drama
Wagner Moura, Ana de Armas, and Brian F. O'Byrne star in a drama about an attack on a United Nations mission in Baghdad shortly after the American invasion in 2003.

WED / April 15

Moves to a new night and time.
  The Big Interview With Dan Rather Talk AXS, 8p
  Deadly Recall Reality ID, 10p
▣ The Innocence Files Documentary
Netflix's nine-episode documentary series from Liz Garbus, Alex Gibney, and Roger Ross Williams focuses on eight wrongful convictions investigated by The Innocence Project.
▣ Mrs. America Trailer Trailer2 Drama
Like last month's Devs, it's another FX series that isn't on FX; instead, it's a Hulu exclusive. Cate Blanchett makes her American TV debut in this nine-part limited series about the 1970s campaign to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment in which she plays Phyllis Schlafly, the conservative activist (or gadfly, as she was oft-described in the press) who opposed the movement. Sarah Paulson, Elizabeth Banks, Uzo Aduba, Rose Byrne, Margo Martindale, James Marsden, Ari Graynor, John Slattery, Melanie Lynskey, Tracey Ullman, Niecy Nash, and Jeanne Tripplehorn are just some of the other stars in what could be 2020's best TV cast. The first three episodes stream today, but the remaining six will arrive one per week.
▣ Outer Banks Trailer Drama
  Property Brothers: Forever Home Reality HGTV, 9p
  The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills Reality Bravo, 8p
▣ What We Do in the Shadows Trailer Comedy 10p
Season 2 guests include Mark Hamill and Haley Joel Osment. Two new episodes air back-to-back tonight, and each episode will also stream on Hulu the following day.

▣ Underwater Trailer Action/Thriller/Sci-fi/Horror ($) Rent/Buy (Digital)
▣ Valley Girl Trailer Rom-com ($) Rent/Buy (Digital)
The 1983 cult classic starring Nicolas Cage is available to stream (for a price) for the first time in its history. It's a much better film than you think, and boasts a killer soundtrack.
MON / April 13
  Agua Donkeys Trailer Comedy Quibi
  American Dad! Animation/Comedy TBS, 10p
▣ The Bachelor: Listen to Your Heart Trailer Reality competition 8p
The latest Bachelor spinoff is bascially Flirty Dancing but with singing rather than hoofing. Twenty singles will go on music-related dates and sing to and with each other until they can't take it anymore are gradually voted off the competition by a panel of experts.
▣ The Baker and the Beauty Trailer Drama/Comedy 10p
A remake of an Israeli series, this Miami-set romance traces the unlikely relationship between a Cuban-American man (Victor Rasuk) working in his family's bakery and an internationally famous fashion mogul (Nathalie Kelley) whom he meets on a wild night out. The adaptation comes from Dean Georgaris (The Brave, Bluff City Law).
  Bedlam Documentary 10p
  Biography: Kenny Rogers Trailer Documentary/Music A&E, 9p
  Botched Reality E!, 9p

▣ Baptiste Drama 10p
Six-part spinoff from The Missing returns Tchéky Karyo as the titular French detective. Tom Hollander and Jessica Raine also star.
▣ Belgravia Trailer Drama Epix, 9p
Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes returns to TV with a six-part adaptation of his own novel set in 19th century London that is co-produced by ITV. Tamsin Greig, Philip Glenister, Harriet Walter, Tom Wilkinson, and Alice Eve star.
  Biography: Dolly Trailer Documentary/Music A&E, 8p

▣ Insecure Trailer Comedy 10p
▣ Killing Eve Trailer Drama AMC/BBC America, 9p
Rescheduled from April 26. The hit series returns for a third season under the guidance of its third showrunner/head writer, Suzanne Heathcote (Fear the Walking Dead). Cast additions include Gemma Whelan (Game of Thrones), Harriet Walter (Succession) and Danny Sapani.
  NBA HORSE Challenge Sports/Live event ESPN, 7p
In an attempt to air a sport, ESPN has enlisted current and former NBA and WNBA stars to play games of "HORSE" together yet separately (with each player shooting on their own home courts). We assure you that this is an actual event that is happening.
  A Question of Faith Drama Lifetime, 8p
  Raw Terror Reality ID, 9p
▣ Run Trailer Comedy/Drama 10:30p
Produced by Fleabag's Phoebe Waller-Bridge and created by Vicky Jones (who worked with Waller-Bridge on both that show and Killing Eve), this rom-com-thriller stars Merritt Wever (Unbelievable, Nurse Jackie) as a woman living a boring suburban life who receives an out-of-the-blue text from her one-time college sweetheart (Domhnall Gleeson) that promises to shake up her life for the better.
  Stalker in the Attic Drama LMN, 8p
  This Is Stand Up Trailer Documentary 10p

▣ Tooning Out the News Trailer Animation/Comedy/Talk CBS All Access
Rescheduled from March 2020. What if The Daily Show, but a cartoon? This hybrid series from some of the folks behind The Late Show With Stephen Colbert and Our Cartoon President features animated newscasters discussing the day's events—and interviewing real-life (non-animated) figures like Eric Swalwell, Thomas Friedman, and Alan Dershowitz. New segments stream daily from Monday through Thursday, and will be compiled into a full-length weekly episode each Friday.
▣ The Turning Drama/Horror ($) Buy (Digital)

▣ Home Before Dark Trailer Drama Apple TV+
Based on the true story of kid journalist Hilde Lysiak, this Apple drama series finds a young girl (The Florida Project's Brooklynn Prince) moving to a small town and uncovering a cold case that the town—and her father (Jim Sturgess)—tried to cover up. Jon M. Chu (Crazy Rich Asians) directs and produces. Three episodes stream today, and the remaining seven will arrive weekly. The series has already been renewed for a 2nd season.
  Into the Dark: Pooka 2: Pooka Lives Trailer Horror
  It Started as a Joke Documentary VOD ($)
New documentary chronicles 10 years of the Eugene Mirman Comedy Festival.

  StarBeam Animation/Family
▣ Tales From the Loop Trailer Drama/Sci-fi Prime Video
Amazon's new sci-fi series is inspired by the futuristic artwork of Swedish painter Simon Stålenhag. Writer Nathaniel Halpern (Legion) created the series, which counts Matt Reeves (War for the Planet of the Apes) among its producers and Mark Romanek (Never Let Me Go) among the directors for this eight-episode first season, which focuses on the inhabitants of the rural Swedish town housing "The Loop," a machine designed to unlock the mysteries of the universe and make the impossible possible. Rebecca Hall, Paul Schneider, and Jonathan Pryce star.
▣ The Whistlers Foreign/Comedy VOD ($)
THU / April 2
  Black Files Declassified Reality Science, 10p
▣ Broke Trailer Comedy 9:30p
The first series for Will & Grace writer/producer Alex Herschlag, Broke centers on an "outrageously wealthy trust fund baby" (Jaime Camil of Jane the Virgin) who is suddenly cut off by his father. Short of money and living arrangements, he and his wife (Natahsa Leggero) move into the house of her estranged sister (longtime NCIS star Pauley Perrette) in the San Fernando Valley. Hijinks ensue, we imagine.
▣ Cursed Films Trailer Documentary Shudder
Five-part series examines horror films that have been plagued by "curses," including Poltergeist, Twilight Zone: The Movie, and The Exorcist.

TUE / March 24
▣ Council of Dads Drama 10p
Special sneak preview tonight; the series returns on Thursday, April 30. Loosely inspired by Bruce Feiler's memoir (which Fox previously attempted to turn into a sitcom), this Jerry Bruckheimer-produced drama should target the same audiences who flock to similarly sentimental NBC shows This Is Us and The Village. (Well, they didn't exactly "flock" to the latter, but you get the idea.) Dads revolves around a husband and father who enlists his friends to serve as back-up dads for his children after he is diagnosed with cancer. Sarah Wayne Callies, Clive Standen, Tom Everett Scott, and J. August Richards head the cast for series creators Joan Rater and Tony Phelan (who previously collaborated on CBS's Doubt).

FRI / March 6
▣ Amazing Stories Trailer Drama/Anthology/Sci-fi Apple TV+
One of the very first projects announced for Apple's streaming service was this reboot of the Twilight Zone-influenced 1985 Steven Spielberg anthology series that was first developed for NBC (home of the original). The new version comes from producers and Once Upon a Time veterans Eddy Kitsis and Adam Horowitz (replacing Bryan Fuller, the original showrunner who left due to creative differences—i.e., an unwillingness to bend to Apple's preferences for family-friendly fare) and will include stand-alone episodes directed by Mark Mylod, Michael Dinner, and more. Stars include Josh Holloway, Dylan O'Brien, Sasha Alexander, Kerry Bishé, Edward Burns, and Robert Forster (in his final performance). Five episodes debut today, with five more to come at a later date.

▣ Devs Trailer Drama/Sci-fi
If an FX series isn't on FX, is it still an FX series? In an attempt to make the streaming wars as confusing as possible, Disney has decided that some FX titles will now be available exclusively on Hulu and never air on FX. (But they are not Hulu shows—let's get that straight.) Up first among these "FX on Hulu" exclusives is this mysterious tech thriller from Ex Machina writer-director Alex Garland. Nick Offerman, Sonoya Mizuno, Zach Grenier, Jin Ha, and Alison Pill star in a story about a software engineer who suspects that her tech company employer may be responsible for the death of her boyfriend. Garland wrote and directed all eight episodes. Two of them stream today, with the remaining six arriving one per week.

▣ Dispatches From Elsewhere Trailer Opening scene Drama 10p
Jason Segel returns to television for the first time since How I Met Your Mother with this mysterious anthology series which he also created and produces. The 10 hourlong episodes find four ordinary people challenged to uncover a mystery hiding within their city (Philadelphia)—a concept based loosely on the real-life, San Francisco-based alternate reality game called Games of Nonchalance. Sally Field, Andre 3000, Richard E. Grant, and Eve Lindley also star. Another new episode airs Monday night at 10p, the show's regular timeslot going forward.

▣ Hunters Trailer Red-band trailer Drama Prime Video
Al Pacino may be one letter short of an EGOT, but the E isn't what's missing. (Hint: It's time to hit the recording studio.) Nevertheless, Hunters marks the stage and screen star's first regular TV series role. Created by newcomer David Weil and produced by Jordan Peele, the 10-episode thriller tells the story of a group of Nazi hunters in late-1970s New York City who uncover a conspiracy to create a "Fourth Reich" in America. Logan Lerman, Josh Radnor, Saul Rubinek, Carol Kane, Jerrika Hinton, and Lena Olin also star.
▣ The Last Thing He Wanted Trailer Drama/Thriller
Dee Rees (Mudbound) directs an adaptation of the Joan Didion novel about a political journalist in 1984 who is pulled too deep into a story she is investigating relating to the Iran-Contra scandal. The big-name cast includes Anne Hathaway, Willem Dafoe, Ben Affleck, Rosie Perez, Mel Rodriguez, Toby Jones, and Edi Gathegi. Despite the big names involved, critics clearly disliked the film when it debuted at the Sundance Film Festival last month.

▣ Zoey's Extraordinary Playlist Drama 9p
The rare network show to start with a "Z," Zoey is a magical realist drama from Austin Winsberg (Jake in Progress, The Sound of Music Live!) and producer Paul Feig. Jane Levy stars as a "whip-smart" San Francisco-based coder who suddenly gains the ability to hear the thoughts and desires of people around her through—wait for it—song. Is it a blessing? A curse? Well, that depends on how good the songs are. Lauren Graham, Skylar Astin, Mary Steenburgen, Peter Gallagher, Alex Newell, John Clarence Stewart, and Andrew Leeds fill out the cast.

▣ High Fidelity Trailer Comedy/Drama
Originally ordered for Disney+ but moved to the older-skewing Hulu, this series adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel (previously adapted into a 2000 feature film by Stephen Frears) stars Zoe Kravitz as a gender-reversed version of the book's main character, an obsessive record store owner who revisits five of her exes on a quest for self-improvement. ▣ Utopia Falls Trailer Drama/Sci-fi/Musical
If you stream only one culturally diverse teen sci-fi musical drama series today ... well, it's gotta be this one, because we can't think of any others. ▣ Cherish the Day Trailer Drama OWN, 10
The latest TV project from Ava DuVernay traces key moments in the relationship of a couple (Xosha Roquemore and Alano Miller), with each episode depicting a single day and the season as a whole spanning five years. It's an anthology series, so a potential future season would follow a different couple. Another new episode airs tomorrow at 8p.
▣ For Life Drama 10p
This 50 Cent-produced drama is inspired by the true story of Isaac Wright, Jr., a wrongfully convicted drug kingpin who was eventually exonerated and became a lawyer, ultimately arguing cases in the same court where he was given a life sentence. Created by Hank Steinberg (The Last Ship), the show begins with its protagonist (Nicholas Pinnock) still in prison. Indira Varma, Mary Stuart Masterson, Glenn Fleshler, and Dorian Missick also star.

▣ Locke & Key Trailer Drama/Fantasy
After numerous failed attempts (by Hulu and Fox, among others) to bring Joe Hill's graphic novel series to the small screen over the past decade, Locke & Key finally found a home at Netflix. This 10-episode first season retains the writer/producer of the previous failed pilot (Lost vet Carlton Cuse, joined by Meredith Averill) but features a new cast led by Jackson Robert Scott, Connor Jessup, Emilia Jones, Darby Stanchfield, and Bill Heck. The story features a mother of three children, a murdered husband, and a set of keys that provide supernatural powers—and bring with them great danger.

THU / February 6
▣ Briarpatch Trailer Drama USA, 10p
Created by critic/writer/podcaster Andy Greenwald and produced by Mr. Robot's Sam Esmail, Briarpatch is an anthology series that will follow a different story each season with something akin to Fargo's darkly comedic, quirky, neo-noir tone. Season 1 adapts the 1984 Ross Thomas novel of the same name and stars Rosario Dawson as a political fixer who returns to her small Texas hometown to investigate her sister's suspicious death. Jay R. Ferguson (in a scene-stealing performance), Kim Dickens, Alan Cumming, Chris Mulkey, and Ed Asner also star. Critics saw the first two episodes at TIFF last fall and offered somewhat tentative enthusiasm for the series.

▣ Indebted Comedy 9:30p
This single-camera full-house comedy stars Adam Pally and Abby Elliott as a young married couple raising a pair of kids. Suddenly, they find themselves forced to take in his parents (Fran Drescher and Steven Weber) after they run into major debt problems. The series comes from The Goldbergs and Mulaney writer Dan Levy.
▣ Interrogation Trailer Drama CBS All Access
Based on a true crime story about a man convicted of murdering his mother but who has spent two decades proclaiming his innocence, this CBS All Access original series will have all episodes available to stream at once, and is designed to be viewed in any order (aside from the first and last episodes) so that you can follow the evidence—structured mainly as a series of interrogations—as you wish. Peter Sarsgaard, Kyle Gallner, and David Strathairn head the cast.
▣ Katy Keene Trailer Drama 8p
The CW's final newcomer this season is a Greg Berlanti-produced spinoff from Riverdale focusing on four twentysomethings pursing fame in New York City. Pretty Little Liars' Lucy Hale stars as the title character, an aspiring fashion designer who befriends Riverdale character and would-be singer-songwriter Josie McCoy (Ashleigh Murray, who is leaving Riverdale as a result). Jonny Beauchamp and Julia Chan play the other two young artists in their orbit. Expect Katy Keene to have a much lighter tone than its sister show—and, since Keene takes place about five years after Riverdale, don't expect any crossovers between the two shows (though producers aren't ruling out showing glimpses of one or more Riverdale characters as they would appear five years later).

▣ McMillions Trailer Documentary 10p
This bizarre true-crime tale recounts the attempts of an ex-cop to build a nationwide conspiracy with the goal of rigging the Monopoly contest at McDonalds. He succeeded—for a while, at least—in stealing millions of dollars (and, we assume, countless hot fudge sundaes), but the fact that this miniseries exists should be your first hint that things don't end well for anyone involved. New episodes air weekly.

▣ Star Trek: Picard Trailer Drama/Sci-fi CBS All Access
Patrick Stewart returns as Starfleet's all-time greatest captain (hey, we're just stating facts) in a new series that picks up over two decades after the events of Star Trek: The Next Generation and its various film spinoffs. Filling out the main cast are Michelle Hurd, Santiago Cabrera, Alison Pill, Isa Briones, and Harry Treadaway, but you'll also see some familiar faces from TNG (and Voyager), including Brent Spiner, Jonathan Frakes (who also directs several episodes), Marina Sirtis, and Jeri Ryan. Novelist Michael Chabon is among the writers and serves as showrunner for the 10-episode season, which is not a miniseries as originally believed, and has in fact already been renewed for a 2nd season.

▣ Little America Trailer Drama/Anthology Apple TV+
Apple hasn't exactly come out of the gate strong with its new streaming service, which has produced few if any noteworthy shows in its opening months (despite huge budgets). But the tech giant will be rolling out plenty of new programming throughout 2020. First up is this anthology series from the husband and wife team behind The Big Sick, Emily V. Gordon and Kumail Nanjiani, along with Master of None co-creator Alan Yang and The Office's Lee Eisenberg. In its first season (and a second has already been greenlit), Little America will offer eight half-hour tales of the immigrant experience in present-day America, inspired by the true stories reported in the column of the same name at Epic Magazine. Apple is departing from its usual weekly rollout and will make all episodes available to stream at once.

▣ Lincoln Rhyme: Hunt for the Bone Collector Drama 8p
Russell Hornsby (of Grimm and the just-canceled Proven Innocent) heads the cast of this series adaptation of Jeffery Deaver's novel The Bone Collector, which was previously made into a not all that good 1999 film. He plays Lincoln Rhyme, a former forensic specialist with the NYPD who was forced to retire when an encounter with a serial killer left him paralyzed. But he is brought back in when a young detective (Arielle Kebbel of Midnight, Texas) has a lead on the same killer. Michael Imperioli, Brían F. O'Byrne, Brooke Lyons, and Tate Ellington also star. The adaptation comes from relative newcomer Mark Bianculli and former Justified writer/producer V.J. Boyd. Note that The Blacklist will go on a brief hiatus to make way for this newcomer, which runs until March.
▣ Medical Police Trailer Comedy
The team behind Adult Swim hits Children's Hospital and NTSF:SD:SUV:: returns with a similar satire of TV procedurals, this time for Netflix. Many of Hospital's cast members will appear in the new series—which is technically a sequel, dealing with the outbreak of a deadly virus—including Erinn Hayes, Rob Huebel, Malin Akerman, Lake Bell, Rob Corddry, and Ken Marino. Guests include Joel McHale, Randall Park, Craig Robinson, Fred Melamed, Jason Schwartzman, and Lilly Singh.

▣ Party of Five Trailer Drama Freeform, tbd
Reboot of the 1990s series of the same name (which ran for six seasons on Fox) offers a timely take on the story of five children who must support each other after they lose their parents—in this case, because their parents are deported to Mexico. The first half of tonight's two-episode debut will also be available to stream one week early (on Jan. 1) via Freeform's app and website and Hulu.
  Single Parents Comedy 9:30p

TUE / January 7

  Ellen's Game of Games Game show 8p
  Emergence Drama 10p
  FBI Drama 9p
▣ FBI: Most Wanted Drama 10p
Fulfilling the TV axiom that says every Dick Wolf series gets a spinoff, Most Wanted first debuted as a backdoor pilot on the April 2nd episode of Wolf's FBI. The spinoff will center on the FBI division charged with tracking down the criminals on the Bureau's "most wanted" list (in case that show title didn't make this crystal clear already). Julian McMahon, Kellan Lutz, Nathaniel Arcand, Roxy Sternberg, and Keisha Castle-Hughes star. (Alana De La Garza was originally set to move from the main series to Most Wanted but will now remain where she is on FBI, though she will guest occasionally on the new show.)
  Finding Your Roots Reality 8p
  Gordon Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back Reality 9p
  Guardians of the Glades Reality Discovery, 10p
  The Haves and the Have Nots Drama OWN, 9p
  Hot & Heavy Reality TLC, 10p
  Ink Master Reality competition Paramount, 10p
▣ Jeopardy: The Greatest of All Time Game show 8p
Special multi-day tournament (which marks Jeopardy's first prime-time network television airing in over three decades) pits the game show's all-time winningest champions (James Holzhauer, Ken Jennings, and Brad Rutter) against each other. Subsequent episodes will air each night until someone wins a total of three matches.
  Live Twice, Love Once (Vivir dos veces) Foreign/Comedy
  mixed-ish Comedy 9p

▣ Schitt's Creek Trailer Comedy Pop, 9p
  Siesta Key Reality MTV, 8p
  Vanderpump Rules Reality Bravo, 9p
▣ Zoey's Extraordinary Playlist Drama 10p
[Special sneak preview tonight; the official debut is February 16.] The rare network show to start with a "Z" (joining such greats as Zorro and Son and Zoe, Duncan, Jack and Jane), Zoey is a magical realist drama from Austin Winsberg (Jake in Progress, The Sound of Music Live!) and producer Paul Feig. Jane Levy stars as a "whip-smart" San Francisco-based coder who suddenly gains the ability to hear the thoughts and desires of people around her through—wait for it—song. Is it a blessing? A curse? Well, that depends on how good the songs are. Lauren Graham, Skylar Astin, Mary Steenburgen, Peter Gallagher, Alex Newell, John Clarence Stewart, and Andrew Leeds fill out the cast.

SAT / January 4
▣ Dracula Trailer Drama/Horror
The creative team behind Sherlock (Mark Gatiss and Steven Moffat) offers a new take on another literary figure: Bram Stoker's Dracula. A co-production with the BBC (which gets the series a few days earlier), the new series is set in Victorian London (and Transylvania) and will span just three episodes for its first season, though each is feature-length. Claes Bang (The Square, Borgen) stars as Count Dracula, and he's joined in the cast by Dolly Wells, Joanna Scanlan, Morfydd Clark, and Gatiss (who co-wrote each of the three episodes with Moffat).
  Go! Go! Cory Carson Animation/Family

▣ Deputy Trailer Drama 9p
Castle writer Will Beall, who created the recent (not so good) TV adaptation of Training Day, returns with another law enforcement drama series. This one follows the Los Angeles County Sheriff's department—specifically, a man (Stephen Dorff) who gets the department's top job after the death of the former sheriff thanks to "an arcane rule forged back in the Wild West." (We're assuming that rule is "Finders Keepers.") David Ayer (Suicide Squad) directs the pilot and is also a producer on the series.
  Dr. Pimple Popper Reality TLC, 9p
